intro: Bakerella hoyifolia subsp. hoyifolia, commonly known as the Hoyi's bakerella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, glossy leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or heathland environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
